channel.title: Comments on: Tune Library
channel.description: WordPress Plugins, Plugin Development Cookbook and random thoughts

item.title: By: yel
item.dc:creator: yel
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/tune-library/comment-page-3/#comment-878">sam</a>.
Hi Sam, Just to be sure, you are trying to import files with a csv file in WordPress 3.4.x, right? I just tested in 3.4.2 and it worked perfectly. Did you try importing the original template or only a modified version of the file with your own contents. If the latter, how many entries did you have in the file? How large was it?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to sam.

Hi Sam, Just to be sure, you are trying to import files with a csv file in WordPress 3.4.x, right? I just tested in 3.4.2 and it worked perfectly. Did you try importing the original template or only a modified version of the file with your own contents. If the latter, how many entries did you have in the file? How large was it?

item.title: By: sam
item.dc:creator: sam
item.description: this seems like a great plugin but is it working on the currently wordpress version as it seems that i cannot load the csv list, nothing shows on the output.
item.content:encoded: this seems like a great plugin but is it working on the currently wordpress version as it seems that i cannot load the csv list, nothing shows on the output.

item.title: By: yel
item.dc:creator: yel
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/tune-library/comment-page-3/#comment-875">Wedding DJ Sydney</a>.
That's one way to do it. Although not as interactive and immersive as having the user parse your music collection right from your site.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Wedding DJ Sydney.

That’s one way to do it. Although not as interactive and immersive as having the user parse your music collection right from your site.

item.title: By: Wedding DJ Sydney
item.dc:creator: Wedding DJ Sydney
item.description: Hey man, I have itunes playlists on my website and I just used Print as PDF from in iTunes.
item.content:encoded: Hey man, I have itunes playlists on my website and I just used Print as PDF from in iTunes.

item.title: By: Roy
item.dc:creator: Roy
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/tune-library/comment-page-3/#comment-873">Roy</a>.
So the row count is 0. And after the import xml script is done running, there is no message saying how many records were imported. So i guess the problem is getting the information into the DB.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Roy.

So the row count is 0. And after the import xml script is done running, there is no message saying how many records were imported. So i guess the problem is getting the information into the DB.

item.title: By: Roy
item.dc:creator: Roy
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/tune-library/comment-page-3/#comment-872">Roy</a>.
Nevermind, I found the tracks table. Let me see what I can do to populate it. Thanks Yannick!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Roy.

Nevermind, I found the tracks table. Let me see what I can do to populate it. Thanks Yannick!

item.title: By: Roy
item.dc:creator: Roy
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/tune-library/comment-page-3/#comment-871">yel</a>.
Thanks so much for the quick response. Where would I find the tracks table? I can't find any kind of table under the pluginstune-library directory. Is it somewhere else?
Roy
item.content:encoded:
In reply to yel.

Thanks so much for the quick response. Where would I find the tracks table? I can’t find any kind of table under the pluginstune-library directory. Is it somewhere else?

Roy

item.title: By: yel
item.dc:creator: yel
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/tune-library/comment-page-3/#comment-870">Roy</a>.
Hi Roy, before deleting the contents of the tracks table, did you look to check if any records had been loaded into the table? I see that basic output from Tune Library is making it onto the page, but no content, indicating that it can't find data in the tracks table.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Roy.

Hi Roy, before deleting the contents of the tracks table, did you look to check if any records had been loaded into the table? I see that basic output from Tune Library is making it onto the page, but no content, indicating that it can’t find data in the tracks table.

item.title: By: Roy
item.dc:creator: Roy
item.description:
Yannick,
First of all, thank you so much for the work you've put in to this plugin. I think the concept is awesome, I just haven't been able to get it to work. Please help. I place the [tune-library] onto a page but nothing shows up.
I have installed the plugin to Word Press and activated it, then included [tune-library] onto a page that I wanted it to go into:
www.soentertaining.com/music/
and into a new page with no other content other than [tune-library]:
www.soentertaining.com/tune-library/
I tried uploaded my library file as an xml and as a csv (deleting the previous database using the "delete imported library" link in the Tune-Library settings page before re-loading.
Thanks, Roy
item.content:encoded:
Yannick,

First of all, thank you so much for the work you’ve put in to this plugin. I think the concept is awesome, I just haven’t been able to get it to work. Please help. I place the [tune-library] onto a page but nothing shows up.

I have installed the plugin to Word Press and activated it, then included [tune-library] onto a page that I wanted it to go into:

http://www.soentertaining.com/music/

and into a new page with no other content other than [tune-library]:

http://www.soentertaining.com/tune-library/

I tried uploaded my library file as an xml and as a csv (deleting the previous database using the “delete imported library” link in the Tune-Library settings page before re-loading.

Thanks,
Roy
